Granting Access Rights at the Component Level

Within a server configuration, every project offers the same set of public filters and queries. These filters and queries are also available in all project views. Therefore, if users can see a view, they can apply all available public filters and queries, as long as no access rights have been set.

If you have the server-level right to Administer component-level access rights, you can set access rights to public filters and queries on the <component> Access Rights dialogs. These rights specify the users and groups who can create and apply filters and queries for a specific component in the server configuration.

Access rights can also be set on a per filter or query basis. See Granting Access Rights for Specific Filters and Queries.

To set component-level access rights:

  1. Select a project view.

  2. Select the component tab.

  3. Select the <component> > Advanced > Component Access Rights command from the menu bar. The <component> Access Rights dialog appears.

  4. Select the appropriate node.

    • To control who can create public filters and queries for the component, use the Component node.

    • To control who can use public filters for the component, use the Filter node.

    • To control who can use public queries for the component, use the Query node.

  5. From the Access Rights dialog, click Add to add a user or group. The Assign Access Rights To dialog opens.

  6. Select a user or group. Users are listed by their user names and groups are listed by their position in the group hierarchy, except for the All Users group.

  7. Select the Grant option button. Note: Never select the Deny option button unless you are creating an exception. See Setting Access Rights Exceptions.

  8. Click OK to return to the Access Rights dialog.

  9. Select and/or clear the appropriate check boxes for the user or group.

  10. Repeat steps 4-9, as required.

  11. Click OK when you are done.

Component  Access Rights

Component Node

Create public filters

Create public filters for the component.

Create public queries

Create public queries for the component.

Filter node

See object and its properties

See public filters for this component in the filters list, and view their properties in the Filters dialog.

Modify properties

Change the properties for public filters for the component. The properties that can be modified for a filter are its list of displayed fields, its sorting and grouping rules, the query associated with it, and its context (the items of the component to which it can be applied).

Delete object

Delete public filters for the component from its list of filters.

Change object access rights

Change the access rights for public filters for the component.

Query node

See object and its properties

See public queries in the Queries dialog, and view their properties in the Edit Query dialog.

Modify properties

Change the properties for public queries for this component. The properties that can be modified are the name and conditions of the query.

Delete object

Delete public queries for the component from the list of queries.

Change object access rights

Change the access rights for public queries for the component.
